00026 #ifndef resource_h
00027 #define resource_h
00028 
00029 #include <string>
00030 
00031 #ifndef _error_h
00032 #include "Error.h"
00033 #endif
00034 
00035 using std::string;
00036 
00046 class Resource {
00047 public:
00048 
00066     enum rule { overwrite, replace, fallback };
00067 
00070     Resource() :d_url(""), d_rule(Resource::overwrite) {}
00071 
00075     Resource(const string &u) :d_url(u), d_rule(Resource::overwrite) {}
00076 
00080 #ifdef WIN32
00081     //  VC++ doesn't like using "Resource" before it is exhaustively defined
00082     //  so much.  Seems we can get away with it in the absense of the 'const'
00083     //  however, like in the no-arg constructor above.  ROM - 6/14/03.
00084     Resource(const string &u, const rule &r) :d_url(u), d_rule(r) {}
00085 #else
00086     Resource(const string &u, const Resource::rule &r) :d_url(u), d_rule(r) {}
00087 #endif
00088 
00099     Resource(const string &u, const string &r) throw(Error) : d_url(u) {
00100     if (r == "replace")
00101         d_rule = Resource::replace;
00102     else if (r == "fallback")
00103         d_rule = Resource::fallback;
00104     else if (r == "overwrite" || r == "default")
00105         d_rule = Resource::overwrite;
00106     else
00107         throw Error(string("An AIS Resource object was created with an unknown rule type '") + r);
00108     }
00109 
00110     virtual ~Resource() {}
00112     virtual string get_url() const {
00113     return d_url;
00114     }
00115 
00118     virtual void set_url(const string &u) {
00119     d_url = u;
00120     }
00121 
00123     virtual Resource::rule get_rule() const {
00124     return d_rule;
00125     }
00126 
00129     virtual void set_rule(const Resource::rule &r) {
00130     d_rule = r;
00131     }
00132 
00137     friend ostream &operator<<(ostream &os, const Resource &r);
00138 
00139     
00140 private:
00141 
00142     string d_url;
00143     Resource::rule d_rule;
00144 };
00145
